[[Desha Putra Sammanaya]] |laterwork= }} [[Major General]] '''Larry A.R. Wijeratne''' [[Uttama Seva Padakkama|USP]], [[Sri Lanka Artillery|SLA]] ([[1950]] - 14 May 1998) was the former Commanding Officer of 51-4 Brigade based in [[Jaffna]]. ==Early life and family== He completed his education at Nugawela Central College. At school, he excelled in both studies, sports alike and was a [[Queen's Scout]]. His wife was Brigadier Indira Wijeratne of the Sri Lanka Army Legal Branch and he was the father of two sons Bhagya and Dulanjaya. == Career== After leaving school he joined the army as an officer cadet and was commissioned as a [[Second Lieutenant]] in the [[Sri Lanka Artillery]]. During his career he held many positions within the army including that of instructor at the Army Training Centre, Diyatalawa (now the [[Sri Lanka Military Academy]]). He had been awarded the [[Uttama Seva Padakkama]], [[Sri Lanka Armed Services Long Service Medal]], [[North and East Operations Medal]], [[Purna Bhumi Padakkama]], [[Vadamarachchi Operation Medal|Operation Wadamarachchi Medal]], [[Riviresa Campaign Services Medal]], and 50th Independence Anniversary Commemoration Medal for his service during the course of his military career. Brigadier Larry Wijeratne was appointed as commanding officer of 51-4 Brigade at Vadamarachchi in Jaffna in 1997. During this time he gained the respect of the people of Jaffna and was much loved by them. == Death == On the last day of his duty assignment he was killed by an [[LTTE]] [[suicide bomber]][http://www.janes.com/security/international_security/news/sentinel/sent000904_6_n.shtml Jane's Sentinel examines the success of the LTTE in resisting the Sri Lankan forces] at Velvetiturai in [[Jaffna]] on 14 May 1998, when he attended a Jaffna traders' felicitation lunch just before leaving on transfer as deputy commandant of the [[General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University|Kotelawela Defence Academy]].
